intro: Chrysanthemum leucanthemum var. hispidum, commonly known as the woolly leucanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its fuzzy, grayish-green foliage and daisy-like yellow flowers with white centers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soil. It is a perennial species that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems that help reduce water loss. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
